trans-unit.source: Converts data input to the attribute relation file format used by the Weka toolset
trans-unit.target: Converts data input to the attribute relation file format used by the Weka toolset

trans-unit.source: You can use the <ui>Convert to ARFF</ui> module to convert datasets and results in Azure Machine Learning to the attribute-relation file format (ARFF).
trans-unit.target: You can use the <ui>Convert to ARFF</ui> module to convert datasets and results in Azure Machine Learning to the attribute-relation file format (ARFF).

trans-unit.source: ARFF is the format used by the Weka toolset.
trans-unit.target: ARFF is the format used by the Weka toolset.

trans-unit.source: Although there are no examples specific to these formats, you can see examples of how format conversion is used by exploring these sample experiments in the <externalLink><linkText>Model Gallery</linkText><linkUri>http://gallery.azureml.net/</linkUri></externalLink>:
trans-unit.target: Although there are no examples specific to these formats, you can see examples of how format conversion is used by exploring these sample experiments in the <externalLink><linkText>Model Gallery</linkText><linkUri>http://gallery.azureml.net/</linkUri></externalLink>:

trans-unit.source: The <externalLink><linkText>Color-Based Image Compression</linkText><linkUri>http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=525272</linkUri></externalLink> sample exports the datasets used for each portion of the analysis to files for reproducibility and use on other analytics platforms.
trans-unit.target: The <externalLink><linkText>Color-Based Image Compression</linkText><linkUri>http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=525272</linkUri></externalLink> sample exports the datasets used for each portion of the analysis to files for reproducibility and use on other analytics platforms.

trans-unit.source: The <externalLink><linkText>Cross Validation for Binary Classification sample</linkText><linkUri>http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=525734</linkUri></externalLink> exports the results of cross validation to files so that the results for multiple models can be compared by using a tool such as Excel.
trans-unit.target: The <externalLink><linkText>Cross Validation for Binary Classification sample</linkText><linkUri>http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=525734</linkUri></externalLink> exports the results of cross validation to files so that the results for multiple models can be compared by using a tool such as Excel.

trans-unit.source: Typically an ARFF data file is comprised of two sections:
trans-unit.target: Typically an ARFF data file is comprised of two sections:

trans-unit.source: Defines the list of the attributes (in columns) and their data types.
trans-unit.target: Defines the list of the attributes (in columns) and their data types.

trans-unit.source: The header can also contain multiple comment lines that describe the data source or any other notes.
trans-unit.target: The header can also contain multiple comment lines that describe the data source or any other notes.

trans-unit.source: % Source: Iris dataset, UCI % 0 = Iris-setosa, 1= Iris-virginica @RELATION iris @ATTRIBUTE sepal_length NUMERIC @ATTRIBUTE sepal_width NUMERIC @ATTRIBUTE petal_length NUMERIC @ATTRIBUTE petal_width NUMERIC @ATTRIBUTE class {0, 1}
trans-unit.target: % Source: Iris dataset, UCI % 0 = Iris-setosa, 1= Iris-virginica @RELATION iris @ATTRIBUTE sepal_length NUMERIC @ATTRIBUTE sepal_width NUMERIC @ATTRIBUTE petal_length NUMERIC @ATTRIBUTE petal_width NUMERIC @ATTRIBUTE class {0, 1}

trans-unit.source: If the dataset you are converting does not have column names, use <link xlink:href="370b6676-c11c-486f-bf73-35349f842a66" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Metadata Editor</link> to add column names before using <ui>Convert to ARFF</ui>.
trans-unit.target: If the dataset you are converting does not have column names, use <link xlink:href="370b6676-c11c-486f-bf73-35349f842a66" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Metadata Editor</link> to add column names before using <ui>Convert to ARFF</ui>.

trans-unit.source: The data section consists of comma-separated values, much like a CSV file without column headings.
trans-unit.target: The data section consists of comma-separated values, much like a CSV file without column headings.

trans-unit.source: For additional information about the ARFF file format, see the Weka Wiki page: <externalLink><linkText>ARFF (developer version)</linkText><linkUri>http://weka.wikispaces.com/ARFF+%28developer+version%29</linkUri></externalLink>.
trans-unit.target: For additional information about the ARFF file format, see the Weka Wiki page: <externalLink><linkText>ARFF (developer version)</linkText><linkUri>http://weka.wikispaces.com/ARFF+%28developer+version%29</linkUri></externalLink>.

trans-unit.source: Studio saves ARFF files by using the ARFF 3.0 format.
trans-unit.target: Studio saves ARFF files by using the ARFF 3.0 format.

trans-unit.source: You cannot overwrite an existing ARFF file in Azure Storage.
trans-unit.target: You cannot overwrite an existing ARFF file in Azure Storage.
